Sec. 24-41.13. Fire extinguishing systems using halon.
Except as required by the South Florida Fire Prevention Code, as same may be amended from time to time, or as required by State law, rule or regulation, it shall be unlawful after September 26, 1991, for any person to release or cause, let, allow, permit, or suffer the releasing of any halon from a fire extinguishing system during the training of personnel or the testing of the fire extinguishing system.
It shall be unlawful for any person, after September 26, 1991, to repair, service or maintain or to cause, let, allow, permit or suffer the repairing, servicing or maintenance of any fire extinguishing system without properly using approved recycling or recovery equipment.
Recovered halon which cannot be reused or recycled shall be disposed of in a manner approved in writing by the Director or the Director's designee.
